com.github.wuic.util
Class WuicScheduledThreadPool

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      com.github.wuic.util.WuicScheduledThreadPool
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public final class WuicScheduledThreadPool
extends Thread

This class is used internally by WUIC to control the number of created threads for different tasks. When a peace of code needs to create asynchronous task in WUIC, it always uses this singleton which wraps a thread pool. The class is tread safe and don't need to be called with a mutex.

The singleton adds a hook with Runtime.addShutdownHook(Thread) to shutdown the pool when executed.

Since:
0.4.0
Version:
1.2
Author:
Guillaume DROUET

public static WuicScheduledThreadPool getInstance()

Returns:

executeEveryTimeInSeconds

public ScheduledFuture<?> executeEveryTimeInSeconds(Runnable job,
                                                    int delay)

Schedules an execution in a specified delay of a given job. Once the job is executed, its execution will be repeated in the initial delay, and so on.

Parameters:
job - the job to execute
delay - the delay between executions
Returns:
an object which gives control over scheduled executions

executeAsap

public <T> Future<T> executeAsap(Callable<T> job)

Executes as soon as possible the given job and returns the related Future.

Parameters:

Returns:
the future result
